thread.title: Eva Moskowitz supports Trump’s education secretary pick
thread.title_full: Eva Moskowitz supports Trump’s education secretary pick | New York Post

author: Selim Algar
title: Eva Moskowitz supports Trump’s education secretary pick
text:
Charter school leader Eva Moskowitz threw her support behind Donald Trump’s education secretary pick on Tuesday, arguing that the nation’s foundering public school system requires a systemic overhaul.
Betsy DeVos — who faces her confirmation hearing Tuesday — has expressed vehement support of charters and school choice, stoking the ire of teachers unions across the country.
Moskowitz, the force behind the high-performing Success Academy network, officially endorsed DeVos on Tuesday and stressed a need for wholesale reform.
“It does not take years of teaching in the classroom to understand that public education in this country is in deep crisis,” she said in a statement. “Globally, 35 other countries outrank the U.S. in student math performance, and 20 beat us in reading.”
Moskowitz, who has been agitating for charter expansion in New York City, said DeVos was a promising agent for sorely needed change.
“I believe Betsy DeVos has the talent, commitment, and leadership capacity to revitalize our public schools and deliver the promise of opportunity that excellent education provides, and I support her nomination as U.S. Secretary of Education,” Moskowitz said.
American Federation of Teachers president Randi Weingarten has repeatedly ripped Trump’s choice, arguing that DeVos’ support for the charter sector harms public schools and that her lack of classroom experience should count heavily against her.
Weingarten in a recent speech called DeVos “the most anti-public education nominee in the history of the department.”
But critics countered that her distaste for DeVos is rooted primarily in a desire to maintain the political power and influence of her union.
